qas.question: What empire conquered most of the subcontinent in the 3rd and 4th centuries BC?
After the 3rd century BC, what style of literature grew in northern area of the subcontinent?
What form of metal was developed and  exported from southern India?
What was the period following 3rd century BC and extending 1500 years called?
What was the foremost dynasty of the the Golden Age period?

context: Most of the subcontinent was conquered by the <a0_0>Maurya Empire<a0_0/> during the 4th and 3rd centuries BCE. From the 3rd century BC onwards <a1_0>Prakrit and Pali<a1_0/> literature in the north and the Sangam literature in southern India started to flourish. <a2_0>Wootz steel<a2_0/> originated in south India in the 3rd century BC and was exported to foreign countries. Various parts of India were ruled by numerous dynasties for the next 1,500 years, among which the <a4_0>Gupta<a4_0/> Empire stands out. This period, witnessing a Hindu religious and intellectual resurgence, is known as the classical or "<a3_0>Golden Age of India<a3_0/>". During this period, aspects of Indian civilization, administration, culture, and religion (Hinduism and Buddhism) spread to much of Asia, while kingdoms in southern India had maritime business links with the Roman Empire from around 77 CE. Indian cultural influence spread over many parts of Southeast Asia which led to the establishment of Indianized kingdoms in Southeast Asia (Greater India).
